Definition.WordDefinition:
Ghostly \Ghost"ly\, a. [OE. gastlich, gostlich, AS. g[=a]stlic. See {Ghost}.] 1. Relating to the soul; not carnal or secular; spiritual; as, a ghostly confessor. [1913 Webster]
Save and defend us from our ghostly enemies. --Book of Common Prayer [Ch. of Eng. ] [1913 Webster]
One of the gostly children of St. Jerome. --Jer. Taylor. [1913 Webster]
2. Of or pertaining to apparitions. --Akenside. [1913 Webster]

Definition.WordDefinition: ghostly adj : like or being a phantom; "a ghostly face at the window"; "a phantasmal presence in the room"; "spectral emanations"; "spiritual tappings at a seance" [syn: {apparitional}, {ghostlike}, {phantasmal}, {spectral}, {spiritual}] [also: {ghostliest}, {ghostlier}]
